name: Embassy Suites Dallas - Near the Galleria

reviews.text: I'm writing to recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Addison in Dallas. I really enjoyed the cooked breakfast and I considered the three nights for the price of two deal to be a good bargain. The front desk staff were excellent (and very cute!) and even got me a power converter for free when I didn't have one that matched my laptop. Rooms were clean, bed very comfy etc. Only thing was - no cutlery available in the rooms and if you have any leisure/business in the city and you don't have a car you're better off saving on taxis and staying somewhere closer as the taxis drivers are bandits!
reviews.title: Good stay!

reviews.text: I think I read someone else's review that stated that this hotel hosts kid sleepovers. . . apparently this is pretty popular . . . the number of kids running around the hotel was kind of annoying. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel because we were visiting family, but it was pretty noisy in the evening. The swans were beautiful, but I'd like to start a movement to "FREE BARRON AND QUEEN". I don't know anything about swans, but I can't imagine that they are happy in such a small space. Breakfast was good, but I think the dishwasher must've been broken . . . I picked up several plates that were DISGUSTINGLY dirty. Someone must've complained, the dishes were a little cleaner the next day. We like staying at E.S., but we won't be staying at this one again. We'll opt for the E.S. - Outdoor World, near the Grapevine Mills Mall.
reviews.title: Kid sleepovers . . . .totally strange!

reviews.text: This hotel is so good at what it does, that the only suggestion I had for them at checkout was to have peanut butter available for my breakfast bagel.
reviews.title: So welcoming...
Excellent Hotel.
reviews.text: Among the many benefits and conveniences: There is a pair of Royal Swans swimming around in the atrium - how's that for not feeling like you're at home? On my first of two stays in a two-week period, the housekeeper had crafted a swan out of a hand towel and left it on the bathroom vanity. There's a free shuttle to all of the many office buildings (and the GALLERIA) in the area that runs until 10 p.m. There's a CVS next door for the inevitable items you forgot to bring along. The room service lady, Carmen, made me feel right at home and fed me well both of the nights I was holed up in my room trying to beat a deadline. There is a volume control on the wall in the bathroom - you can listen to the bedroom TV while you're in the shower. How's that for cool??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few minor "cons": The "business center" is one lonely PC loaded with one of those "restriction" packages - I wanted to pull up an urgent email attachment when I checked in, but no-go. No printer, either. Bummer. They say that they serve lunch, but when I tried to grab a sandwich on the way to my meeting there was nobody around to make one. Breakfast, however, is pretty good - omelets to order along with the usual stuff.
reviews.title: Great Value , Great Location

reviews.text: I only stayed 1 night at the Embassy Suites in Dallas (near the Galleria) for a business trip.
reviews.title: Embassy Suites in Dallas - Typical Stay

likes.liked: — Free Breakfast, Comfortable Beds, Huge Suite

reviews.text: Memorable items:
reviews.title: Very Comfortable for our Purpose

reviews.text: * The suite was VERY spacious, large, and clean (two tvs which I didn't watch either). The King size bed was VERY comfortable.
reviews.title: Great location and service but Dirty rooms

reviews.text: * Loved the happy hour with FREE snacks and FREE adult beverages while socializing with my colleagues.
reviews.title: Before i even got to stay here......

likes.liked: — Customer service and very rude front office manager.

reviews.text: * Loved the FREE HOT breakfast the following morning with made to order omlet
reviews.title: Worst Embassy Suites

reviews.text: Best thing about the hotel was the great service from the staff. Laura at the front desk and Elena from Room Service were great. I will say the food was typical "hotel' food, but everything else was perfect. The complimentary shuttle service helped me get to my training site. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to other business travelers.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: Dallas, the city is always buzzing, as soon as you get down at the Fortworth airport and get out, you can see some suped up trucks, mustangs raring around on the road.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel, but hated the laundry

likes.liked: — Proximity to the Galleria and other areas

reviews.text: I took my rental car and drove down to the Embassy suites, near the Galleria. not a very fashionable but a simple looking hotel with loads of services and things to do. The rooms are big and good, as I entered mine I was welcomed by a moderate size living room sitting which was clubbed witha small kitchenette and had a pathway to the bedroom. The bedroom was of big enough size too with good selection of channels on TV.
reviews.title: One of the BEST in the area

reviews.text: The hotel had a good gym facility and a nice indoor swimming pool, though I could never try my luck at the pool. One thing I like about the Hilton Embassy Suites was the eye for customer service delivery, so in the hotel you have Laundrette's where you can go and wash your clothes on your own if you find hotel Laundry service too expensive, just popo the change, pop the clothes, go to the bar grab a few drinks during the Manager's reception time and hey your clothes are ready too. The team kids travelling with me used to do that, I somehow preferred to use the hotel laundry, saved me the effort of ironing the clothes. :)
reviews.title: Great value for family of 5 while husband was on business.

reviews.text: The only time when i didn't like the hotel was when the Laundry service lost one of my Boss shirt and the manager behaved helpless and didn't do anything about it. However, the Embassy suites is the place for you to stay if you don't want to be in downtown and still want to be in centre of shopping areas.
reviews.title: Just What We Were Looking For!

likes.liked: — Manager's Happy Hour, Suite Layout, Complimentary Breakfast, Location
likes.disliked: — Long wait for the elevators, No covered parking

reviews.text: This hotel was nice, clean and spacious, but don't drink the coffee in your room! I made myself a cup of coffee, put some sugar and half&half in it and within 5 minutes could feel and my stomach start churning. I think it was bad half & half they had there. How often do they cycle out that half & half?
reviews.title: Nice, Clean and Spacious but...

reviews.text: Winter travel means lots of dry skin and good lotion is a must. The body lotion there is also wimpy and does not do a good job of soothing/protecting dry skin.
reviews.title: Simple and comfy

reviews.text: Other than this, breakfast is great, staff is very good and so is the location.
reviews.title: Good hotel, bad management and security.

reviews.text: This hotel was simple and relaxed. Kids enjoyed the live swans in the lobby. Parents enjoyed the hot cooked-to-order breakfast...omelets, hash browns, pancakes, bacon and sausage. Pool area was fun however the "hot tub" was lukewarm. Nice exercise room with TV's on the equipment. Nothing fancy here, but a good time was had by all.
reviews.title: Crickets, crickets, more crickets...

reviews.text: Embassy Suites in general provides a good value. I have stayed at this hotel many times and had a good experience, but on this ocassion one particular weakness came glaring through. On Thanksgiving day when the hotel is packed with a football game crowd and holiday shoppers for the Galleria nearby, security was only provided for part of the night. As soon as the security guard left at 5:00 AM, thieves came through the parking lot and cleaned out more than 5 vehicles without being detected at all. Poor lighting is provided in the parking lot on the side and rear and there is a problem neighborhood nearby. Management seemed to have little concern for the customers who were robbed and did not offer anything to help. We were provided a form to fill out and I was given the phone number for a glass repair service that I had to contact. No additional discounts were offered as some consideration for our inconvenience. I had to ask for a discount and received half off of one night's rate. This seemed like an insult considering what happened and the time and trouble all of the customers will have as the result of the hotel not being willing to provide better security in their parking lot. If you are considering shopping at the Galleria for the holidays, you may want to find a hotel with better security.
reviews.title: Stayed here just one night and was very...

description: Located in North Dallas on the Dallas Tollway business corridor, our hotel is just 500 yards from renowned shopping mall, Galleria Dallas. Ride our complimentary shuttle service to Addison's Restaurant Row, with over 40 restaurants to choose from. Our two-room suites, each featuring a living room with a 42-inch HDTV, a sofa bed, mini-fridge, microwave, and an ergonomic work station with high-speed internet access. We also offer a free-cooked-to-order breakfast each morning, and in the evenings enjoy the complimentary cocktails at the Manager’s Reception. Workout in our modern fitness center, take a dip in the indoor pool or a delicious meal at Ethan's American Bistro. Take advantage of the useful services and equipment in the complimentary business center.
